meanings.definition: The addition of a word or phrase to clarify or explain a preceding word or phrase.
meanings.sent1: In her speech, she used epexegeses to make sure everyone understood her point clearly.
meanings.sent2: The professor's epexegeses helped the students grasp the complex concept.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's epexegeses of the joke made the audience burst into laughter.
meanings.sent4: His epexegeses of the ancient text shed new light on its meaning.
meanings.sent5: The artist's epexegeses of the painting revealed hidden details.

meanings.definition: The act of providing additional commentary or explanation to a text.
meanings.sent1: The editor's epexegeses enhanced the readers' understanding of the article.
meanings.sent2: During the lecture, the speaker's epexegeses clarified the main points.
meanings.sent3: The writer's epexegeses of the story added depth to the plot.
meanings.sent4: Her epexegeses of the poem brought out its underlying themes.
meanings.sent5: The historian's epexegeses of the document revealed new insights.
